datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in global scope.
scope=global

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: wifi

echo-interval.name: echo-interval
echo-interval.help: Time between echo requests sent by the managed WTP, AP, or FortiAP (1 - 255 sec, default = 30).

nat-session-keep-alive.name: nat-session-keep-alive
nat-session-keep-alive.help: Maximal time in seconds between control requests sent by the managed WTP, AP, or FortiAP (0 - 255 sec, default = 0).

discovery-interval.name: discovery-interval
discovery-interval.help: Time between discovery requests (2 - 180 sec, default = 5).

client-idle-timeout.name: client-idle-timeout
client-idle-timeout.help: Time after which a client is considered idle and times out (20 - 3600 sec, default = 300, 0 for no timeout).

client-idle-rehome-timeout.name: client-idle-rehome-timeout
client-idle-rehome-timeout.help: Time after which a client is considered idle and disconnected from the home controller (2 - 3600 sec, default = 20, 0 for no timeout).

auth-timeout.name: auth-timeout
auth-timeout.help: Time after which a client is considered failed in RADIUS authentication and times out (5 - 30 sec, default = 5).

rogue-ap-log.name: rogue-ap-log
rogue-ap-log.help: Time between logging rogue AP messages if periodic rogue AP logging is configured (0 - 1440 min, default = 0).

fake-ap-log.name: fake-ap-log
fake-ap-log.help: Time between recording logs about fake APs if periodic fake AP logging is configured (1 - 1440 min, default = 1).

sta-offline-cleanup.name: sta-offline-cleanup
sta-offline-cleanup.help: Time period in seconds to keep station offline data after it is gone (default = 300).

sta-offline-ip2mac-cleanup.name: sta-offline-ip2mac-cleanup
sta-offline-ip2mac-cleanup.help: Time period in seconds to keep station offline Ip2mac data after it is gone (default = 300).

sta-cap-cleanup.name: sta-cap-cleanup
sta-cap-cleanup.help: Time period in minutes to keep station capability data after it is gone (default = 0).

rogue-ap-cleanup.name: rogue-ap-cleanup
rogue-ap-cleanup.help: Time period in minutes to keep rogue AP after it is gone (default = 0).

rogue-sta-cleanup.name: rogue-sta-cleanup
rogue-sta-cleanup.help: Time period in minutes to keep rogue station after it is gone (default = 0).

wids-entry-cleanup.name: wids-entry-cleanup
wids-entry-cleanup.help: Time period in minutes to keep wids entry after it is gone (default = 0).

ble-device-cleanup.name: ble-device-cleanup
ble-device-cleanup.help: Time period in minutes to keep BLE device after it is gone (default = 60).

sta-stats-interval.name: sta-stats-interval
sta-stats-interval.help: Time between running client (station) reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 10).

vap-stats-interval.name: vap-stats-interval
vap-stats-interval.help: Time between running Virtual Access Point (VAP) reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 15).

radio-stats-interval.name: radio-stats-interval
radio-stats-interval.help: Time between running radio reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 15).

sta-capability-interval.name: sta-capability-interval
sta-capability-interval.help: Time between running station capability reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 30).

sta-locate-timer.name: sta-locate-timer
sta-locate-timer.help: Time between running client presence flushes to remove clients that are listed but no longer present (0 - 86400 sec, default = 1800).

ipsec-intf-cleanup.name: ipsec-intf-cleanup
ipsec-intf-cleanup.help: Time period to keep IPsec VPN interfaces up after WTP sessions are disconnected (30 - 3600 sec, default = 120).

ble-scan-report-intv.name: ble-scan-report-intv
ble-scan-report-intv.help: Time between running Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) reports (10 - 3600 sec, default = 30).

drma-interval.name: drma-interval
drma-interval.help: Dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA) schedule interval in minutes (1 - 1440, default = 60).

ap-reboot-wait-interval1.name: ap-reboot-wait-interval1
ap-reboot-wait-interval1.help: Time in minutes to wait before AP reboots when there is no controller detected (5 - 65535, default = 0, 0 for no reboot).

ap-reboot-wait-time.name: ap-reboot-wait-time
ap-reboot-wait-time.help: Time to reboot the AP when there is no controller detected and standalone SSIDs are pushed to the AP in the previous session, format hh:mm.

ap-reboot-wait-interval2.name: ap-reboot-wait-interval2
ap-reboot-wait-interval2.help: Time in minutes to wait before AP reboots when there is no controller detected and standalone SSIDs are pushed to the AP in the previous session (5 - 65535, default = 0, 0 for no reboot).
